question: What is the effect of incorporating  degree‐heterogeneous networks structure in an SEIR model on disease dynamics, compared to a homogeneous‐mixing network? Analyze it using both deterministic analytical methods and stochastic simulations
next_plan: We have completed all phases up to initial analysis. Deterministic threshold analysis shows substantial lowering of epidemic threshold in degree-heterogeneous (BA) network compared with homogeneous mixing and moderately heterogeneous (ER). Stochastic FastGEMF simulations on 5,000–node ER and BA networks (single run each) confirm faster, higher peak on BA with earlier timing. Extracted key metrics: peak I, peak time, final epidemic size, duration. Next iteration we will: (1) repeat simulations with multiple replicates (nsim ≥20) and varying β values around calculated thresholds to generate robust averages and confidence intervals; (2) compute additional metrics (attack rate, R_eff over time, doubling time) and summarize in tables; (3) complete literature review citing relevant works; (4) draft full IEEE-style LaTeX paper encompassing title, abstract, introduction, methodology, results, discussion, conclusion, references; (5) embed figures for epidemic curves and degree distributions; (6) compile references list from gathered papers.
